poem:
Title: Tread of Progress, Shadow of Regret

In industry's heart, a spectral hum.
Banned beast, PCB, in clandestine drum,
Like a silenced bell, still calls for vacancies,
Unheard, unseen, but brimming with tenacity.
Four decades past, yet our sin remains,
In phantom fervour, an echo stains,
In our hands, life's delicate thread,
but underfoot, nature's deathbed.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cancer-causing PCB chemicals still being produced despite 40-year-old ban Industry could be producing more cancer-causing PCB chemicals today than at any other point in history, despite their production having been banned more than 40 years ago. PCBs, or polychlorinated biphenyls, are human-made substances that were used as coolants and lubricants in electrical equipment until they were banned due to their links to health problems and because they do not break down easily in the environment.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
